place.name: CREGRINA
place.gazetteerText: CREGRINA, or Crigrina, a parish in the district of Builth and county of Radnor; on the river Eddw, 5½ miles E by N of Builth r. station, and 13½ WSW of Kington. Post town, Builth, Breconshire. Acres, 1, 595. Real property, £973. Pop., 124. Houses, 24. The property is much subdivided. The living is a rectory, united with the p. curacy of Llanbadarn-y-garregg, in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £120. Patron, the Bishop of St. Davids. The church is old and decayed. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
